newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa industrials end weak, battered by rand.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa industrials end weak, battered by rand.

text.p: South African industrial shares ended weak in busy trading, battered by an ailing rand, dealers said. But gold shares finished firm lifted by a better rand gold price and stronger bullion.
Comments from central Reserve Bank governer Chris Stals' that he did not see an interest rate cut next year, but possibly a rate hike, added to the gloom on the market, dealers said.
Dealers said the market would watch the rand closely on Tuesday as there were no major economic indicators due this week.
The overall index shed 20.9 points to 6,964.3, the industrial index was off 37.5 points to 8,221.4 and the gold index gained 13.8 points to 1,717.7.
